column2: ('recipe_title', 'Melon and Cucumber Salad with Mint Coriander Dressing')
column3: ('ingredients', ['1 ripe melon', '1 cucumber', '2 vine tomatoes', 'A handful of fresh mint leaves', 'A handful of fresh coriander leaves', '2 tablespoons of olive oil', '1 tablespoon of mint sauce', '1 toasted baguette', 'Salt to taste'])
column4: ('steps', ['Step 1: Halve the melon, remove the seeds and cut into small cubes. column2: ('recipe_title', 'Smoked Haddock Tart with Gruyère and Poached Eggs')
column3: ('ingredients', ['all-butter shortcrust pastry', 'smoked haddock', 'full-fat milk', 'egg yolks', 'English mustard', 'butter', 'plain flour', 'gruyère', 'poached eggs', 'chives', 'baby spinach leaves', 'olive oil', 'salt', 'pepper'])
column4: ('steps', ['Step 1: Preheat your oven to 375°F. Roll out the all-butter shortcrust pastry on a lightly floured surface and fit it into a tart pan. Prick the bottom with a fork and chill in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes.', 'Step 2: Cover the pastry with parchment paper and fill with pie weights. Bake in the preheated oven for about 15 minutes, then carefully remove the weights and parchment and bake for another 7-10 minutes, or until golden. Allow to cool.', 'Step 3: While the pastry is cooling, poach the smoked haddock in the full-fat milk until it flakes easily. Remove the haddock from the milk, reserving the milk, and flake the fish into large pieces.', 'Step 4: In a separate pan, melt the butter and stir in the plain flour to make a roux. Gradually whisk in the reserved milk from poaching the haddock, until you have a smooth sauce. Stir in the English mustard and grated gruyère until melted and smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste.', 'Step 5: Spread the flaked haddock over the cooled pastry shell, then pour over the gruyère sauce. Bake in the oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until the filling is set and golden.', 'Step 6: While the tart is baking, poach the eggs in simmering water until the whites are set but the yolks are still runny. Toss the baby spinach leaves in a little olive oil, salt, and pepper.', 'Step 7: To serve, cut the tart into slices and top each slice with a poached egg. Sprinkle with chopped chives and serve with the dressed baby spinach on the side.'])

column3: ('ingredients', ['oil', 'baby new potato', 'mint', 'salt'])
column4: ('steps', ['Step 1: Wash the baby new potatoes thoroughly and place them in a pot. Add enough water to cover the potatoes and bring to a boil. Cook until the potatoes are tender.', 'Step 2: While the potatoes are cooking, heat a small amount of oil in a pan. Add the mint leaves and sauté until they become fragrant. Remove from heat and set aside.', 'Step 3: Once the potatoes are cooked, drain the water and let them cool for a few minutes. Then, cut the potatoes in half.', 'Step 4: In the same pan, add a bit more oil and heat it up. Add the halved potatoes and sauté until they start to turn golden brown. Season with salt to taste.', 'Step 5: Add the sautéed mint to the pan and mix well with the potatoes. Cook for another minute or two to let the flavors meld together.', 'Step 6: Remove from heat and serve the minty baby new potatoes while hot. Enjoy!'])

column3: ('ingredients', ['4 large potatoes', '2 fillets of smoked haddock', '200g button mushrooms', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley', '2 tablespoons plain flour', '2 tablespoons sunflower oil', '2 eggs', '100g cooked frozen peas', 'Salt and pepper to taste'])
column4: ('steps', ['Preheat the oven to 375° F.', 'Peel and coarsely grate the potatoes into a colander. Rinse under running water to remove excess starch. Squeeze out any excess water and let the potatoes drain for 2 minutes.', 'Heat 2 tablespoons of sunflower oil in a large skillet over moderate heat. Add the button mushrooms and cook, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes or until the mushrooms are tender. Season with salt and pepper to taste.', 'In a separate pan, cook the smoked haddock fillets over medium heat until they are cooked through. Flake the fish into small pieces and set aside.', 'In a large bowl, beat the eggs. Stir in the grated potatoes, cooked mushrooms, flaked haddock, cooked peas, and chopped parsley. Season with salt and pepper to taste.', 'Grease a 13-by-9 inch baking dish with some sunflower oil. Spoon the potato mixture into the dish, spreading it out evenly.', 'Bake in the middle of the oven for 50 minutes, or until the top is golden and crispy. Let it cool for a few minutes before serving.'])

column3: ('ingredients', ['all-butter puff pastry', 'icing sugar', 'strawberry', 'vanilla pod', 'double cream', 'golden caster sugar', 'honey'])
column4: ('steps', ['Preheat oven to 400°F. Roll out the all-butter puff pastry on a floured surface to a 14-inch round. Transfer to an 11-inch-diameter tart pan with a removable bottom. Press the pastry into the pan. Trim the edges to a 1/2-inch overhang; fold in and press, forming double-thick sides. Freeze the crust until firm, about 20 minutes. Bake until light golden, about 20 minutes. Cool. Maintain oven temperature.', 'Pour double cream into a small saucepan. Scrape in seeds from the vanilla pod; add the pod. Bring to a simmer. Remove from heat. Whisk yolks, golden caster sugar and cornstarch in a bowl to blend. Gradually whisk the cream mixture into the yolk mixture. Return to the pan. Whisk over medium heat until the custard thickens and boils, about 2 minutes. Transfer to a bowl; cool. Discard the vanilla pod.', 'Arrange the strawberries on the cooled pastry. Pour the cooled custard over the strawberries. Bake the tart until the filling is set and golden, about 45 minutes. Remove from the oven. Drizzle honey over the tart. Return to the oven for 3 minutes. Cool completely in the pan.', 'Before serving, dust the tart with icing sugar for a sweet finish.'])

column3: ('ingredients', ['200g butter', '200g golden caster sugar', '4 eggs', '200g gluten-free self-raising flour', '1 tsp gluten-free baking powder', '200g mashed potatoes', 'Zest and juice of 2 lemons', 'Zest and juice of 1 orange', '100g icing sugar', '2 tbsp lemon juice', '100g chocolate eggs'])
column4: ('steps', ['Preheat the oven to 180C/160C fan/gas mark 4. Butter and flour a 20cm cake tin.', 'In a large bowl, beat together the butter and golden caster sugar until light and fluffy. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.', 'In a separate bowl, combine the gluten-free self-raising flour and gluten-free baking powder. Gradually add this to the butter mixture, stirring just until blended.', 'Stir in the mashed potatoes, lemon zest, lemon juice, orange zest, and orange juice until well combined.', 'Pour the batter into the prepared cake tin and bake for about 1 hour, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. column3: ('ingredients', ['chicken breasts', 'low-salt chicken stock', 'wholewheat noodles', 'baby corn', 'eggs', 'lemon juice', 'spring onions', 'salt', 'pepper', 'oil'])
column4: ('steps', ['Step 1: Season the chicken breasts generously with salt and pepper. In a large pot, heat some oil over medium heat. Add the chicken breasts and cook until browned on both sides. column2: ('recipe_title', 'Smoky Pancetta and Mixed Greens with Lemon-Mint Dressing')

column4: ('steps', ['Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Place the broccoli on a baking tray. column3: ('ingredients', ['pork sausages', 'red onion', 'red cabbage', 'wholegrain mustard', 'bread rolls', 'eating apple', 'sage leaves', 'red wine vinegar', 'caster sugar', 'salt', 'oil'])
column4: ('steps', ['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Season the pork sausages with salt and sage leaves. Film a roasting pan with the oil and heat over high heat until it is just about at the smoking point. Sear the sausages on all sides until golden, then transfer to the oven and roast, basting frequently with pan juices, until a meat thermometer inserted in the sausages indicates a temperature of 160 degrees, about 35 minutes. Remove the sausages from the oven and allow them to rest for about 10 minutes.', 'Step 2: While the sausages are roasting, slice the red onion and red cabbage. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat, add a bit of oil and sauté the onion until it is golden. Add the red cabbage and continue to cook, stirring occasionally.', 'Step 3: In a small bowl, mix together the red wine vinegar, caster sugar, and wholegrain mustard to make a dressing. Pour this over the sautéed onion and cabbage, stirring well to combine. Cook for a few more minutes until the cabbage is tender.', 'Step 4: Slice the eating apple and add it to the skillet, cooking just until it is warmed through.', 'Step 5: Slice the bread rolls in half and spread a bit of the cabbage mixture on each half. Slice the roasted sausages and arrange them on top of the cabbage. Spoon a bit more of the cabbage mixture over the sausages, then top with the other half of the bread roll.', 'Step 6: Serve the sausage and red cabbage rolls warm, with any remaining cabbage mixture on the side.'])

column3: ('ingredients', ['chicken thighs', 'oranges', 'Dijon mustard', 'olive oil', 'spinach', 'rocket', 'watercress salad', 'cooked beetroot', 'salt', 'sugar'])

column3: ('ingredients', ['green beans', 'butter', 'shallots', 'salt'])
column4: ('steps', ['1. Prepare an ice-water bath in a large bowl.', '2. Bring a pot of water to a boil.', '3. Add green beans to the boiling water and cook until they are tender and bright green, about 4 minutes.', '4. Using a slotted spoon, transfer the green beans to the ice water to stop the cooking process.', '5. Once cooled, drain the green beans and cut them into 2-inch pieces.', '6. In a pan, melt the butter over medium heat.', '7. Add the chopped shallots to the pan and sauté until they are soft and translucent.', '8. Add the green beans to the pan, season with salt, and toss to combine.', '9. Cook for a few more minutes until the green beans are well coated with the butter and shallots.', '10. Serve the buttery green beans with shallots as a delicious side dish.'])

column3: ('ingredients', ['Thai rice noodle', 'sesame oil', 'eggs', 'red chilli', 'ginger', 'peeled cooked Atlantic prawn', 'soy sauce', 'coriander', 'mint', 'lime zest', 'lime juice', 'roasted peanuts', 'salt', 'sugar', 'oil'])
column4: ('steps', ['Use a julienne peeler or mandoline to slice the red chilli and ginger. Place in a bowl and set aside.', 'Boil the Thai rice noodles as per the instructions on the packet. column2: ('recipe_title', 'Roasted Desirée Potatoes with Dill and Onion')
column3: ('ingredients', ['Desirée potatoes', 'olive oil', 'onion', 'dill', 'salt'])
column4: ('steps', ['Wash and peel the Desirée potatoes. Cut them into even-sized pieces.', 'Chop the onion finely.', 'Heat some olive oil in a pan. Add the chopped onion and sauté until it becomes translucent.', 'Add the potatoes to the pan. Stir well to ensure that all the pieces are coated with oil and onion.', 'Season with salt to taste.', 'Transfer the potatoes to a baking dish. column2: ('recipe_title', 'Mediterranean Tomato and Feta Salad with Preserved Lemon Dressing')
column3: ('ingredients', ['fresh tomatoes', 'red onion', 'preserved lemon', 'feta cheese', 'olive oil', 'lemon', 'flat-leaf parsley', 'mint', 'crusty bread'])
column4: ('steps', ['Step 1: Cut the fresh tomatoes into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Thinly slice the red onion. Cut the feta cheese into 1/4-inch-thick slices as well.', 'Step 2: In a bowl, mix together the juice of the lemon, a tablespoon of finely chopped preserved lemon, a handful of chopped flat-leaf parsley and mint, and 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Season with salt and pepper to taste.', 'Step 3: Assemble the salad by layering the sliced tomatoes, red onion, and feta cheese on a platter. Drizzle the preserved lemon dressing over the top.', 'Step 4: Cut the crusty bread into 1/2-inch-thick slices and brush both sides of each slice with some olive oil. Toast the bread slices in a skillet over moderate heat until golden, about 2 minutes on each side.', 'Step 5: Serve the salad with the toasted crusty bread on the side.'])

column3: ('ingredients', ['frozen raspberries', 'brandy', 'raspberry conserve', 'dark chocolate', 'raspberry yogurt', 'fresh vanilla custard', 'chocolate macaroons', 'shop-bought shortbread', 'egg whites', 'icing sugar', 'ground almond', 'cocoa', 'blanched almonds'])
column4: ('steps', ['Heat the oven to 200C/180C fan/gas mark 6. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.', 'In a medium bowl, mix raspberry yogurt, a splash of brandy, and a spoonful of raspberry conserve until smooth. Pour this mixture onto the prepared baking sheet and spread it to about 1/4" thick.', 'Top the yogurt mixture with frozen raspberries and blanched almonds. Freeze until completely firm, about 4 hours.', "While the yogurt mixture is freezing, create a double boiler by bringing a medium pan filled with about an inch of water to a simmer, then turn the heat to as low as it will go. Place a heatproof bowl, that's just big enough to sit on top, onto the pan and make sure the bottom of the bowl does not touch the water.", 'Put the dark chocolate into the bowl. Let the chocolate sit for 1-2 mins to melt slightly, then stir the chocolate every 1-2 mins until it is completely melted. Remove the bowl from the heat.', 'Crush the chocolate macaroons and shop-bought shortbread into fine crumbs. Mix these crumbs with the melted dark chocolate, ground almond, and a spoonful of cocoa. Spread this mixture onto a separate lined baking sheet and bake for 10-15 minutes. Let it cool completely.', 'Once both the yogurt mixture and the chocolate crumb mixture are completely cool, break them into pieces. Layer these pieces in serving glasses, alternating with layers of fresh vanilla custard. Top each glass with a dusting of icing sugar and serve.'])

column3: ('ingredients', ['500g apricots', '250ml apple juice', '500g preserving sugar', '1 lemon', '50g butter'])
column4: ('steps', ['Step 1: Wash the apricots, cut them in half and remove the stones.', 'Step 2: Place the apricots in a large saucepan and add the apple juice. Bring to a simmer over medium heat.', 'Step 3: Add the preserving sugar to the saucepan and stir until it is fully dissolved.', 'Step 4: Zest and juice the lemon, then add both to the saucepan.', 'Step 5: Continue to simmer the mixture, stirring occasionally, for about 30 minutes or until the apricots are soft and the mixture has thickened.', 'Step 6: Cut the butter into small pieces and add it to the saucepan. Stir until the butter is fully melted and incorporated into the mixture.', 'Step 7: Remove the saucepan from the heat and let the mixture cool for a few minutes. Then, pour it into sterilized jars, seal tightly, and let it cool completely before storing.'])

column2: ('recipe_title', 'Potato and Radish Salad with Horseradish Cream')
column3: ('ingredients', ['new or Jersey Royal potatoes', 'horseradish sauce', 'crème fraîche', 'radishes', 'snipped chives or spring onions', 'salt', 'oil'])
column4: ('steps', ['Boil the new or Jersey Royal potatoes in salted water until tender. Drain and let them cool.', 'While the potatoes are cooling, mix together the horseradish sauce and crème fraîche in a bowl.', 'Slice the radishes and add them to the bowl.', 'Chop the snipped chives or spring onions and add them to the bowl.', 'Once the potatoes are cool, cut them into bite-sized pieces and add them to the bowl.', 'Mix together all the ingredients in the bowl until well combined.', 'Season with salt to taste.', 'Serve the salad chilled or at room temperature.'])

column3: ('ingredients', ['butter', 'lamb neck fillets', 'frozen peas', 'chicken stock', 'Baby Gem lettuces', 'salt', 'pepper'])
column4: ('steps', ['Preheat the oven to 200C/180C fan/gas mark 6.', 'Butter a pan or soak a sheet of baking parchment with water, then crumple it and wring it out. Use it to line a 20cm pan.', 'Season the lamb neck fillets with salt and pepper and place them in the prepared pan.', 'Roast the lamb in the preheated oven for about 20 minutes, or until it is cooked to your liking.', 'While the lamb is roasting, heat a large pan over medium heat. column2: ('recipe_title', 'Mixed Fruit and Sherry Cake with Vanilla Custard')
column3: ('ingredients', ['1 cup mixed dried fruit', '1/2 cup raisins', '1/2 cup currants', '1/2 cup sultanas', '1/2 cup sherry', '1 cup butter', '1 cup caster sugar', '3 eggs', '2 cups self-raising flour', '1 tsp baking powder', '1 tsp mixed spice', '1 tsp orange zest', '1 tsp clementine zest', '1/4 cup sloe gin', '2 tbsp apricot jam', '1 cup vanilla custard'])
column4: ('steps', ['1. Preheat the oven to 350°F and butter a 13x9x2-inch glass baking dish.', '2. In a large bowl, combine the mixed dried fruit, raisins, currants, and sultanas. Pour the sherry over the fruit and let it soak for 15 minutes.', '3. In a separate bowl, beat the butter and caster sugar until soft and light. Add the eggs one at a time, beating until smooth after each addition.', '4. In another bowl, mix together the self-raising flour, baking powder, and mixed spice. Gradually add this to the butter mixture, beating on low speed.', '5. Stir in the orange and clementine zest, and the soaked fruit with any remaining sherry. Mix well.', '6. Pour the batter into the prepared dish and bake for about 1 hour, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.', '7. While the cake is baking, heat the sloe gin and apricot jam in a saucepan over low heat until the jam is melted. Brush this glaze over the hot cake as soon as it comes out of the oven.', '8. Let the cake cool in the pan on a rack for about 30 minutes, then invert onto a rack and remove the pan. Let it cool completely.', '9. Serve slices of the cake with a dollop of vanilla custard on top.'])

column3: ('ingredients', ['puff pastry', 'pork sausages', 'sage', 'egg', 'salt', 'oil'])
column4: ('steps', ['Preheat the oven to 200C/180C fan/gas mark 6.', 'In a large nonstick skillet, sauté the pork sausages over medium heat until brown and cooked through, breaking them up with the back of a fork. This should take about 6 minutes.', 'Once the sausages are cooked, transfer them to a bowl and let them cool.', 'In the meantime, roll out the puff pastry and cut it into squares.', 'Place a spoonful of the cooked sausages in the center of each puff pastry square.', 'Sprinkle some sage over the sausages and fold the puff pastry squares to form a triangle. column3: ('ingredients', ['2 cups frozen mixed summer fruits', '1 cup caster sugar', '1 tsp vanilla extract', '1 cup full-fat milk', '2 eggs', '1/2 cup sunflower oil', '2 cups plain flour', '2 tsp baking powder', '1/2 cup caster sugar for topping'])

column3: ('ingredients', ['beef shin', 'neck', 'stewing steak', 'plain flour', 'dripping', 'lard', 'oil', 'shallots', 'beef stock', 'suet', 'fresh grated horseradish', 'self-raising flour', 'salt', 'pepper'])
column4: ('steps', ['Season the beef shin, neck, and stewing steak generously on all sides with salt and pepper.', 'In a large skillet over moderately high heat, warm 2 tablespoons of the oil until hot but not smoking. column3: ('ingredients', ['500g lean minced beef', '1 cup white breadcrumbs', '4 spring onions, finely chopped', '2 garlic cloves, minced', '2 eggs', '1 tsp ground cumin', '1 tsp Tabasco sauce', 'Handful of coriander leaves, chopped', '200g cherry tomatoes, halved', '2 tbsp chilli sauce', '2 tbsp vegetable oil', 'Salt to taste', 'Pepper to taste'])

column3: ('ingredients', ['200g butter', '200g golden caster sugar', '200g self-raising flour', '1 tsp baking powder', '4 eggs', '100ml milk', '100g unsweetened desiccated coconut', '200g frozen raspberries', '2 tbsp raspberry jam', '200ml double cream', '2 tbsp Malibu', 'Zest and juice of 1 lime', '2 tbsp cornflour', '2 tbsp icing sugar', '200ml good-quality ready-made custard', 'Fresh coconut for garnish'])
column4: ('steps', ['Preheat the oven to 180C/160C fan/gas mark 4. Butter and flour a 20cm cake pan.', 'In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. column3: ('ingredients', ['butter', 'unsweetened desiccated coconut', 'golden caster sugar', 'self-raising flour', 'baking powder', 'eggs', 'milk', 'coconut cream', 'cornflour', 'icing sugar', 'good-quality ready-made custard', 'Malibu', 'lime zest', 'lime juice', 'frozen raspberries', 'raspberry jam', 'double cream', 'fresh coconut'])
column4: ('steps', ['Step 1: In a bowl, cream the butter with the golden caster sugar until the mixture is light and fluffy. Beat in the lime zest, lime juice, and Malibu. column3: ('ingredients', ['1 onion', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '100g cubetti di pancetta', '1 garlic clove', '2 thyme sprigs', '500g ready-cooked polenta', '50g parmesan', '200ml single or whipping cream', '500ml chicken or vegetable stock', 'Salt to taste', 'Pepper to taste'])

column2: ('recipe_title', 'Spicy Chicken Stir Fry with Rice Noodles')
column3: ('ingredients', ['chicken', 'fresh root ginger', 'spring onions', 'garlic cloves', 'rice noodles', 'sunflower oil', 'asparagus', 'sugar snap peas', 'green beans', 'cherry tomatoes', 'lime juice', 'light muscovado sugar', 'palm sugar', 'fish sauce', 'red chillies', 'basil leaves', 'mint leaves', 'salted peanuts'])
column4: ('steps', ['1. Start by preparing the ingredients. Slice the chicken into thin strips. Peel and finely chop the fresh root ginger and garlic cloves. Add the cherry tomatoes, lime juice, light muscovado sugar, palm sugar, and fish sauce. Stir well to combine and cook for a few more minutes until everything is heated through.', '7. Add the cooked rice noodles to the pan and toss well to combine with the other ingredients. Cook for a couple of minutes until the noodles are heated through.', '8. Remove the pan from the heat. Stir in the chopped basil and mint leaves. Sprinkle the stir fry with the salted peanuts.', '9. Serve the stir fry hot, garnished with extra basil and mint leaves if desired.'])

column3: ('ingredients', ['200g dark chocolate', '3 eggs', '150g soft light brown sugar', '2 tbsp cocoa', 'Zest and juice of 3 clementines', '200ml double cream', '50g icing sugar', '200g crème fraîche', '100g caster sugar', '1 whole clementine for decoration', 'Silver balls for decoration', 'White stars for decoration'])
column4: ('steps', ['Preheat the oven to 180C/160C fan/gas mark 4. Grease and line a 20cm cake tin with baking parchment.', 'Melt the dark chocolate in a heatproof bowl over a pan of simmering water. Make sure the bottom of the bowl does not touch the water. Once melted, remove from the heat and let it cool slightly.', 'In a separate bowl, beat the eggs and soft light brown sugar together until light and fluffy. Gradually add the melted chocolate, mixing well to combine.', 'Add the cocoa, clementine zest and juice to the chocolate mixture and stir until fully incorporated.', 'Pour the mixture into the prepared cake tin and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the middle comes out clean. Remove from the oven and let it cool in the tin.', 'While the cake is cooling, prepare the icing. Whip the double cream with the icing sugar until it forms soft peaks. Fold in the crème fraîche.', 'Once the cake is completely cooled, remove it from the tin and spread the icing over the top. Sprinkle with caster sugar.', 'Decorate the cake with slices of clementine, silver balls and white stars. Serve and enjoy!'])

column3: ('ingredients', ['4 lemons', '4 globe artichokes', '100g butter', '200ml dry white wine', '100g parmesan', 'Salt to taste'])
column4: ('steps', ['Preheat the oven to 200C/180C fan/gas mark 6.', 'Butter a 20cm pan.', 'Cut the lemons in half and squeeze the juice over the artichokes to prevent them from browning. column3: ('ingredients', ['1 onion', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 tablespoon soft brown sugar', '2 tablespoons wine vinegar', '1 tablespoon Cajun seasoning', '1 can mixed beans', '1 can chopped tomatoes', '1 cup shredded cheddar', '1 bag tortilla chips', '1 ripe avocado'])
column4: ('steps', ['Chop the onion and sauté in olive oil until translucent.', 'Add the soft brown sugar, wine vinegar, and Cajun seasoning to the onions. column3: ('ingredients', ['caster sugar', 'lemon zest', 'lemon juice', 'rosé wine', 'peach schnapps', 'peach', 'lemon', 'ice cubes', 'soda water'])
column4: ('steps', ['Step 1: In a small saucepan, combine the caster sugar, lemon zest, and lemon juice. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring to dissolve the sugar. Blend until smooth.', 'Step 3: Fill a glass with ice cubes. Pour in the peach mixture, followed by a shot of peach schnapps and rosé wine.', 'Step 4: Top up the glass with soda water, stir gently to combine.', 'Step 5: Garnish with a slice of lemon and serve immediately.'])

column3: ('ingredients', ['2 pink grapefruits', '2 cups of natural yogurt', '1 vanilla pod', '4 tablespoons of golden caster sugar', '2 tablespoons of clear honey', 'A handful of mint leaves'])

Enjoy your Pink Grapefruit and Mint Yogurt Parfait!'])

column2: ('recipe_title', 'Prawn and Noodle Stir Fry with Peanut Sauce')
column3: ('ingredients', ['flat rice noodles', 'crunchy peanut butter', 'half-fat coconut milk', 'sweet chilli sauce', 'spring onions', 'cucumber', 'beansprouts', 'cooked peeled prawn', 'salt', 'oil'])
column4: ('steps', ['Slice the spring onions and cucumber into thin strips.', 'Using a small heavy knife, slice the cucumber very thinly into 2- to 3-inch-long strips.', 'Combine the sliced spring onions, cucumber, and beansprouts in a large bowl.', 'In a blender or processor, combine the crunchy peanut butter, half-fat coconut milk, and sweet chilli sauce. Puree until smooth. Thin with water by tablespoonfuls, as desired. Season the sauce to taste with salt.', 'Cook the flat rice noodles as per the package instructions. Once cooked, drain and set aside.', 'Heat some oil in a pan and add the cooked peeled prawns. Stir fry for a few minutes until they are heated through.', 'Add the cooked noodles and the peanut sauce to the pan with the prawns. Toss everything together until well combined.', 'Serve the stir fry topped with the spring onion, cucumber, and beansprout mixture. Drizzle with more peanut sauce if desired.'])

column3: ('ingredients', ['new potatoes', 'Iberico ham', 'rocket leaves', 'Dijon mustard', 'white wine vinegar', 'olive oil', 'mayonnaise', 'snipped chives', 'salt'])
column4: ('steps', ['Boil the new potatoes in salted water until tender. Drain and let them cool.', 'In a separate bowl, mix together Dijon mustard, white wine vinegar, olive oil, mayonnaise, and a pinch of salt to make the dressing.', 'Slice the Iberico ham into thin strips.', 'In a large bowl, combine the cooled potatoes, Iberico ham, and rocket leaves.', 'Pour the dressing over the salad and gently toss to combine.', 'Garnish with snipped chives before serving.'])

column3: ('ingredients', ['red wine', 'cornflour', 'turkey or chicken stock', 'redcurrant jelly', 'turkey juices', 'salt'])
column4: ('steps', ['Mix together the turkey juices, red wine, and turkey or chicken stock in a bowl.', 'In a separate bowl, mix the cornflour with a little bit of water until it forms a paste.', 'Slowly add the cornflour paste to the turkey juice mixture, stirring constantly.', 'Add the redcurrant jelly to the mixture and stir until it is fully incorporated.', 'Season the gravy with salt to taste.', 'Heat the mixture on the stove over medium heat, stirring constantly, until it thickens to your desired consistency.', 'Serve the gravy hot over your turkey or chicken.'])

column2: ('recipe_title', 'Smoked Trout and Celeriac Salad with Rocket and Capers')
column3: ('ingredients', ['1 celeriac', '200g smoked trout', '2 handfuls of rocket', '2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', '1 tablespoon mayonnaise', '1 tablespoon capers', 'Juice of 1 lemon', '2 cornichons', 'A handful of parsley leaves', 'Salt to taste'])
column4: ('steps', ['Peel and grate the celeriac.', 'In a bowl, mix together the grated celeriac, capers, chopped cornichons, lemon juice, mayonnaise, and extra-virgin olive oil.', 'Season with salt to taste.', 'Arrange the rocket on a serving plate.', 'Flake the smoked trout and scatter it over the rocket.', 'Spoon the celeriac mixture over the trout.', 'Garnish with parsley leaves before serving.'])

column3: ('ingredients', ['200g plain flour', '1/4 tsp salt', '100g butter', '50g caster sugar', 'Zest of 1 lemon', '1 egg yolk', '2 tbsp milk', '1 large cooking apple', '200g blackberries', '100g caster sugar'])
column4: ('steps', ['Heat the oven to 200C/180C fan/gas mark 6. Butter a tart pan.', 'In a bowl, combine the plain flour, salt, and lemon zest. Add the butter and rub it into the flour until the mixture resembles breadcrumbs.', 'Stir in the caster sugar. Add the egg yolk and milk and mix until a dough forms.', 'Roll out the dough and use it to line the tart pan. Prick the base with a fork and chill for 15 minutes.', 'Peel and slice the cooking apple. In a bowl, mix the apple slices, blackberries, and caster sugar.', 'Pour the fruit mixture into the tart shell.', 'Bake for 25-30 minutes, until the fruit is tender and the crust is golden. Let it cool before serving.'])

column3: ('ingredients', ['salted butter', 'small salad potato', 'bay leaves', 'full-fat milk', 'salt', 'pepper'])
column4: ('steps', ['Wash and peel the small salad potatoes.', 'In a large pot, melt the salted butter over medium heat.', 'Add the potatoes to the pot and stir until they are well coated with the butter.', 'Add the bay leaves and enough full-fat milk to just cover the potatoes.', 'Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook until the potatoes are tender.', 'Remove the bay leaves and use a blender to puree the soup until smooth.', 'Season with salt and pepper to taste.', 'Serve the creamy potato soup hot.'])

column3: ('ingredients', ['baby salad leaves', 'smoked mackerel fillets', 'horseradish cream', 'shallots', 'red wine vinegar', 'cooked, peeled beetroot', 'olive oil', 'salt', 'pepper'])
column4: ('steps', ['Whisk together horseradish cream, finely chopped shallots, red wine vinegar, and olive oil in a small bowl. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Let the dressing stand for 30 minutes at room temperature before using.', 'Place the baby salad leaves in a large bowl. Drizzle with enough dressing to coat the leaves lightly.
